title: Font used in "The Interview" trailer (2014)
content:
What is the font used in the trailer for "The Interview" with Seth Rogen and James Franco? Not the font used in the logo for the film, but for all the other text. Here's a link:  
 [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WnalZzJ-XS4&feature=youtu.be&t=51s](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419035851/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=WnalZzJ-XS4&feature=youtu.be&t=51s "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WnalZzJ-XS4&feature=youtu.be&t=51s")  
I first thought it was Tank, but that's a little too condensed.  
Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!  
Jeff

Font: 

 Molot 

Solved By: 

 [R.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419035851/http:/typophile.com/user/57325 "View user profile.")
author: worldofjeff

comments.content: Do you mean [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419035851/http:/www.dafont.com/molot.font?text=THIS+IS+THE+END&psize=l)? That’s Molot, a free font.

It's better to capture one or more specific frames and attach the image(s) here, to let people know which fonts you want to identify.

PS: Unless it's the one found by R. above

Thanks R. That's it!  
Sorry if I was unclear fvilanakis. The link I posted was set to begin playing right at the cue point of the text I was looking for, but you're right -- a screen capture would be better.
